description.en: The preceptor Śrīkaṇṭha, son of Umeśa Śaṅkara, suffering from leprosy, worshipped Sūrya everyday with a thousand salutations to get rid of the disease and became healthy due to the japa of Śrīvidyā, renounced at the age of eighteen and reached with a tranquil mind the holy feet of the preceptor Surendradeśika. Avowed to rigoroaus practice of adhering to silence, austere, blessed with a virtue of opting his death day at his will, governed the seat of the Chief of Preceptors for thirteen years and after deputing Śaṅkarendra with due instructions, reached the beatitude on the ninth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Bhādrapada of the year Hevilambi.

zrIvidyAjapatazca nIrujatanurjAtastathA'STAdazE
sannyasyan sa surEndradEzikapadaM prApat prazAntAntaraH..41..
maunI tapaHsvavazamRtyuradhisvapITham abdAMstrayOdaza vihRtya ca zaGkarEndram.
nikSipya dattaguruvAcam alabdha siddhiM saddhEmalambini tathA'hni mahAnavamyAm..42..
